author: m.kalinin
content:
In addition to <@301186049323958275>'s comment, `mixHash` is deprecated by EIP-4399 and is renamed to `prevRandao`. 
I guess the question is about importance of `mixHash` for PoW, this is what YP says:
> PoW is the proof-of-work function which evaluates to an array with the first item being the *mixHash* and the second item being a pseudo-random number cryptographically dependent on *H* and *d*
> 
> *mixHash*: A 256-bit hash which, combined with the nonce, proves that a sufficient amount of computation has been carried out on this block
*H* and *d* are header (I guess without mixhash and nonce) and difficulty respectively. So, according to YP, Ethereum's PoW seal has two parameters
